required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: 12 Week Efficacy and Safety Study of Empagliflozin (BI 10773) in Hypertensive Patients With Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase III Randomised, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled, Parallel Group, Efficacy and Safety Study of BI 10773 (10 mg, 25 mg) Administered Orally, Once Daily Over 12 Weeks in Hypertensive Patients With Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus

brief_summary.textblock: This trial will evaluate safety and efficacy of BI 10773 in hypertensive patients with type 2 diabetes. Since hyperglycaemia and hypertension are key risk factors for both micro- and macrovascular complications, assessment of both glucose and blood pressure lowering effects of BI 10773 in hypertensive patients with type 2 diabetes could provide clinically highly relevant, new information for the use of BI 10773

primary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in HbA1c after 12 weeks of treatment.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean 24-hour Systolic Blood Pressure Change From Baseline
primary_outcome.description: Change from baseline of mean 24-hour systolic blood pressure (SBP).

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean 24-hour Diastolic Blood Pressure Change From Baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in mean 24-hour diastolic blood pressure (DBP) after 12 weeks.
Proportion of patients with HbA1c <7% after 12 weeks.

secondary_outcome.measure: Fasting Plasma Glucose (FPG) Change From Baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in FPG after 12 weeks of treatment.
Change from baseline in body weight after 12 weeks of treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Daytime Mean Systolic Blood Pressure (SBP) Change From Baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in daytime mean SBP after 12 weeks of treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Daytime Mean Diastolic Blood Pressure (DBP) Change From Baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in daytime mean DBP after 12 weeks of treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Nighttime Mean Systolic Blood Pressure (SBP) Change From Baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in nighttime mean SBP after 12 weeks of treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Nighttime Mean Diastolic Blood Pressure (DBP) Change From Baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in nighttime mean DBP after 12 weeks of treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Trough Mean Seated Systolic Blood Pressure (SBP) Change From Baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in Trough Mean Seated SBP after 12 weeks of treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Trough Mean Seated Diastolic Blood Pressure (DBP) Change From Baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in trough mean seated DBP after 12 weeks of treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Patients Reaching Blood Pressure <130/80 mmHg
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of patients reaching blood pressure <130/80 mmHg after 12 weeks of treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Composite Endpoint of Change From Baseline of HbA1c, Systolic Blood Pressure and Body Weight
secondary_outcome.description: A composite endpoint of the following conditions at week 12 compared to baseline (all 3 fulfilled): reduction of HbA1c from baseline of at least 0.5%, reduction of systolic blood pressure > 3 mmHg from baseline and reduction of weight from baseline > 2%
Orthostatic blood pressure (BP) at baseline and after 12 weeks of treatment.

other_outcome.time_frame: From drug administration until last drug administration plus seven days, up to 171 days
other_outcome.description: Number of participants with confirmed hypoglycaemic adverse events

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
1. Patients >=18 years with type 2 diabetes
2. HbA1c of >= 7.0% (53 mmol/mol) and =< 10% (86 mmol/mol)
3. Mean seated systolic blood pressure 130-159 mmHg and diastolic blood pressure 80-99 mmHg
Exclusion criteria:
1. Uncontrolled hyperglycaemia with a glucose level >240 mg/dl (>13.3 mmol/L) after an overnight fast before randomization
2. Known or suspected secondary hypertension
3. Acute coronary syndrome (non-STEMI, STEMI and unstable angina pectoris), stroke or transient ischemic attack within 3 months prior to informed consent

patient_data.ipd_description: Boehringer Ingelheim Policy on Transparency and Publication http://trials.boehringer-ingelheim.com/transparency_policy.html

group.title: Placebo
group.description: A placebo tablet, matching the empagliflozin 10mg and 25mg tablets, taken once daily for 12 weeks.

group.title: Empa 10mg
group.description: Single oral dose of empagliflozin (empa) 10mg taken once daily for 12 weeks.

group.title: Empa 25mg

drop_withdraw_reason.title: Patient refusal to continue,not due toAE

baseline.population: Full analysis set (FAS) included all randomised and treated patients who had a baseline HbA1c value and a baseline mean 24-h SBP value. Treatment assignment as randomized

outcome.title: HbA1c Change From Baseline
outcome.description: Change from baseline in HbA1c after 12 weeks of treatment.
outcome.population: Full analysis set (FAS), which included all randomised and treated patients who had a baseline HbA1c and a baseline mean 24-h systolic blood pressure value. Treatment assignment as randomised. Values after start of antidiabetic rescue therapy were set to missing and last observation carried forward (LOCF) was used for imputation of missing values.

measure.title: HbA1c Change From Baseline
measure.description: Change from baseline in HbA1c after 12 weeks of treatment.
measure.population: Full analysis set (FAS), which included all randomised and treated patients who had a baseline HbA1c and a baseline mean 24-h systolic blood pressure value. Treatment assignment as randomised. Values after start of antidiabetic rescue therapy were set to missing and last observation carried forward (LOCF) was used for imputation of missing values.

analysis.groups_desc: Hierarchical testing structure was: 1) Change from baseline to week 12 in HbA1c, empa 25mg vs placebo 2) Change from baseline to week 12 in mean 24h SBP, empa 25mg vs placebo 3) Change from baseline to week 12 in HbA1c, empa 10mg vs placebo 4) Change from baseline in mean 24h SBP, empa 10mg vs placebo 5) Change from baseline in mean 24h DBP, empa 25mg vs placebo 6) Change from baseline in mean 24h DBP empa 10mg vs placebo.
analysis.p_value_desc: Hierarchical testing, no adjustment of p-values.
analysis.method_desc: Model includes baseline HbA1c as lin. covariate and treatment, baseline renal function, region and baseline N of antihyperten. med. as fixed effects
analysis.estimate_desc: Difference calculated as empa 10mg minus placebo

analysis.groups_desc: Hierarchical testing structure was: 1) Change from baseline to week 12 in HbA1c, empa 25mg vs placebo 2) Change from baseline to week 12 in mean 24h SBP, empa 25mg vs placebo 3) Change from baseline to week 12 in HbA1c, empa 10mg vs placebo 4) Change from baseline in mean 24h SBP, empa 10mg vs placebo 5) Change from baseline in mean 24h DBP, empa 25mg vs placebo 6) Change from baseline in mean 24h DBP empa 10mg vs placebo.
analysis.p_value_desc: Hierarchical testing, no adjustment of p-values
analysis.method_desc: Model includes baseline HbA1c as lin. covariate and treatment, baseline renal function, region and baseline N of antihyperten. med. as fixed effects
analysis.estimate_desc: Difference calculated as empa 25mg minus placebo

outcome.title: Mean 24-hour Systolic Blood Pressure Change From Baseline
outcome.description: Change from baseline of mean 24-hour systolic blood pressure (SBP).
outcome.population: FAS, which included all randomised and treated patients who had a baseline HbA1c and a baseline mean 24-h systolic blood pressure value. Treatment assignment as randomised. Values after start of antidiabetic rescue therapy or change of antihypertensive therapy were set to missing and LOCF was used for imputation of missing values.

outcome.title: Proportion of Patients With HbA1c <7%
outcome.description: Proportion of patients with HbA1c <7% after 12 weeks.
outcome.population: Patients in the full analysis set (FAS) and with baseline HbA1c >= 7%. Treatment assignment as randomised. Non-completers (missing data due to early discontinuation or values after start of rescue medication) considered 'failure' was used as the imputation rule.

outcome.title: Proportion of Patients Reaching Blood Pressure <130/80 mmHg
outcome.description: Proportion of patients reaching blood pressure <130/80 mmHg after 12 weeks of treatment
outcome.population: Patients in the FAS without blood pressure control at baseline. Blood pressure control is defined as DBP<80 mmHg and SBP <130 mmHg. Treatment assignment as randomised. Non-completers (missing data due to early disc, values after start of rescue medication or changes in antihyp. therapy) considered 'failure' was used as the imputation rule.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: A placebo tablet, matching the empagliflozin 10mg and 25mg tablets, taken once daily for 12 weeks.

measure.title: Proportion of Patients Reaching Blood Pressure <130/80 mmHg
measure.description: Proportion of patients reaching blood pressure <130/80 mmHg after 12 weeks of treatment
measure.population: Patients in the FAS without blood pressure control at baseline. Blood pressure control is defined as DBP<80 mmHg and SBP <130 mmHg. Treatment assignment as randomised. Non-completers (missing data due to early disc, values after start of rescue medication or changes in antihyp. therapy) considered 'failure' was used as the imputation rule.

analysis.method_desc: Logistic regression model includes treatment, baseline renal function, region, baseline number of antihypertensive medications and baseline HbA1c
Logistic regression model includes treatment, baseline renal function, region, baseline number of antihypertensive medications and baseline HbA1c

outcome.title: Composite Endpoint of Change From Baseline of HbA1c, Systolic Blood Pressure and Body Weight
outcome.description: A composite endpoint of the following conditions at week 12 compared to baseline (all 3 fulfilled): reduction of HbA1c from baseline of at least 0.5%, reduction of systolic blood pressure > 3 mmHg from baseline and reduction of weight from baseline > 2%
outcome.population: Patients in the full analysis set (FAS). Treatment assignment as randomised. Non-completers (missing data due to early discontinuation, values after start of rescue medication or changes in antihypertensive therapy) considered 'failure' was used as the imputation rule.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: A placebo tablet, matching the empagliflozin 10mg and 25mg tablets, taken once daily for 12 weeks.

group.title: Empa 10mg
group.description: Single oral dose of empagliflozin (empa) 10mg taken once daily for 12 weeks.

group.title: Empa 25mg
group.description: Single oral dose of empagliflozin (empa) 25mg taken once daily for 12 weeks.

measure.title: Composite Endpoint of Change From Baseline of HbA1c, Systolic Blood Pressure and Body Weight
measure.description: A composite endpoint of the following conditions at week 12 compared to baseline (all 3 fulfilled): reduction of HbA1c from baseline of at least 0.5%, reduction of systolic blood pressure > 3 mmHg from baseline and reduction of weight from baseline > 2%
measure.population: Patients in the full analysis set (FAS). Treatment assignment as randomised. Non-completers (missing data due to early discontinuation, values after start of rescue medication or changes in antihypertensive therapy) considered 'failure' was used as the imputation rule.

outcome.title: Orthostatic Blood Pressure
outcome.description: Orthostatic blood pressure (BP) at baseline and after 12 weeks of treatment.
outcome.population: Treated set for patients with available measurements at baseline and week 12. Treatment assignment as first medication taken.

outcome.description: Number of participants with confirmed hypoglycaemic adverse events
outcome.time_frame: From drug administration until last drug administration plus seven days, up to 171 days

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Any publication of the result of this trial must be consistent with the Boehringer Ingelheim publication policy. The rights of the investigator and of the sponsor with regard to publication of the results of this trial are described in the investigator contract.
